Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Hotshot \Hot"shot`\, n. a successful, self-confident person who is regarded by others as highly skilled; -- sometimes used ironically in reference to aggressive persons whose opinion of their own talents is considered exaggerated. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
hotshot \hot"shot`\, a. 1. highly talented, self-confident and successful. [PJC]
2. flamboyantly displaying one's skills. [PJC]

hotshot n : someone who is dazzlingly skilled in any field [syn: {ace}, {adept}, {champion}, {sensation}, {maven}, {mavin}, {virtuoso}, {genius}, {star}, {superstar}, {whiz}, {whizz}, {wizard}, {wiz}]
